name: Andromeda Galaxy
originOfName: Andromeda, which is shortened from "Andromeda Galaxy", gets its name from the area of the sky in which it appears, the constellation of Andromeda.

name: Antennae Galaxies
originOfName: Looks are similar to an insect's antennae.

name: Backward Galaxy
originOfName: It appears to rotate backwards, as the tips of the spiral arms point in the direction of rotation.

name: Black Eye Galaxy
originOfName: It has a spectacular dark band of absorbing dust in front of the galaxy's bright nucleus, giving rise to its nicknames of the "Black Eye" or "Evil Eye" galaxy.

name: Bode's Galaxy
originOfName: Named for Johann Elert Bode who discovered this galaxy in 1774.

name: Butterfly Galaxies
originOfName: Looks are similar to a butterfly.

name: Cartwheel Galaxy
originOfName: Its visual appearance is similar to that of a spoked cartwheel.

name: Cigar Galaxy
originOfName: Appears similar in shape to a cigar.

name: Circinus Galaxy
originOfName: Named after the constellation it is located in (Circinus).

name: Coma Pinwheel Galaxy
originOfName: Named after its resemblance to the Pinwheel Galaxy and its location in the Coma Benerices constellation.

name: Comet Galaxy
originOfName: This galaxy is named after its unusual appearance, looking like a comet.

name: Cosmos Redshift 7
originOfName: The name of this galaxy is based on a Redshift (z) measurement of nearly 7 (actually, z = 6.604)

name: Eye of Sauron
originOfName: Due to its resemblance to the Eye of sauron from the Lord of the Rings

name: Fireworks Galaxy
originOfName: Due to its bright and spotty appearance.

name: Hockey Stick Galaxies
originOfName: Its elongated and curved appearance resembles a hockey stick.

name: Hoag's Object
originOfName: This is named after Art Hoag, who discovered this ring galaxy.

name: Large Magellanic Cloud
originOfName: Named after Ferdinand Magellan

name: Lindsay-Shapley Ring
originOfName: Named after its discoverer, Eric Lindsay, his professor Harlow Shapley, and its nature as a ring galaxy.

name: Little Sombrero Galaxy
originOfName: Named after its similarity to the Sombrero Galaxy.

name: Medusa Merger
originOfName: Ejected dust from the merging galaxies is said to look like the snakes that the Gorgon Medusa from Greek mythology had on her head.

name: Sculptor Dwarf Galaxy
originOfName: Similar to the Sculpture Galaxies

name: Mayall's Object
originOfName: This is named after Nicholas Mayall, of the Lick Observatory, who discovered it.

name: Mice Galaxies
originOfName: Looks are similar to a mouse.

name: Small Magellanic Cloud
originOfName: Named after Ferdinand Magellan

name: Milky Way
originOfName: The appearance from Earth of the galaxy â€“ a band of light.
